definition: to announce the winners in a lottery

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: That's for sure. I am betting on my lucky number again.
sentences.chinese: 我在猜，你大概也很想知道每天的彩票开奖号码了？

sentences.english: Lotto night comes and Babbette still has no luck.
sentences.chinese: 乐透开奖的夜晚来临了，但芭芘特还是没有运气。

sentences.english: When"row preface type" draws lottery in public machine, the lottery ticket number is directly these numbers.
sentences.chinese: 在“排序型”开奖机时，彩票号码直接是这些数字。

sentences.english: Lotto night comes and somebody else wins it.
sentences.chinese: 乐透开奖的晚上，别人把奖赢走了。

definition: to win a prize/a successful gamble
lottery run by China Welfare Lottery, a government agency that uses a portion of the money from ticket sales to fund welfare projects (abbr. for 福利彩票[fu2 li4 cai3 piao4])
to draw the winning ticket (in a lottery)
sports lottery (sports betting run by a government agency, China Sports Lottery) (abbr. for 體育彩票|体育彩票[ti3 yu4 cai3 piao4])
to try to answer a question (in a quiz, guessing game, riddle etc)/quiz game
large-sized (of clothes, shoes)/(old) to give an order/(old) to quit one's job in a store
to throw one's energies (into an activity)/to invest one's emotions (in sth)/to bet/betting
the units place (or column) in the decimal system
